text: Hi. I didn’t find a specific channel for questions about JuMP. Please, advise me if there is a better place for this. Anyway. It is my first time using JuMP and SumOfSquares. I would like to use it to get bounds over time-averages of quantities of solutions of differential equations. I started following the examples in <https://jump.dev/SumOfSquares.jl/stable/>, for bounds of functions and for searching for Lyapunov functions. The only solver I saw being used there is `CSDP`. But I would like to use `SDPA-GMP` since it was the one that I saw working in the MATLAB ecosystem. My Julia code with `CSDP` does not converge properly. But I get an error when replacing `CSDP`with `SDPAFamily`. Is there something else I should do? The error I get is the same error that appears when I replace `CSDP.Optimizer` by `SDPAFamily.Optimizer` in the Lyapunov example <https://jump.dev/SumOfSquares.jl/stable/generated/Lyapunov%20Function%20Search/>

text:
The error is
```ERROR: LoadError: MethodError: Cannot `convert` an object of type MathOptInterface.ConstraintIndex{MathOptInterface.ScalarAffineFunction{BigFloat},MathOptInterface.EqualTo{BigFloat}} to an object of type Int64```

text: Thanks!. I thought the first one was more for math and the second for developers. I will try the second.

elements.text: Thanks!. I thought the first one was more for math and the second for developers. I will try the second.

text: There’s an example with SumOfSquares here: <https://ericphanson.github.io/SDPAFamily.jl/dev/examples/#Polynomial-optimization-1|https://ericphanson.github.io/SDPAFamily.jl/dev/examples/#Polynomial-optimization-1>

elements.text: There’s an example with SumOfSquares here:

text: <@UCZ7VBGUD>, thanks, it worked with `{Float64}` and it solved perfectly!
Now I am ready for my talk tomorrow! :grin:

elements.text: Now I am ready for my talk tomorrow!

text:
For interest
>  I thought the first one was more for math
Nope, its just highliging it means mathematical optimisation and not preformance optimization

>  and the second for developers. I will try the second.
Confusingly, JuMP-dev is the name of the organisation that develops JuMP and so it also the name of that organisations chat channel.
Pretty sure it is because they were happy to manage to buy the jump.dev domain name.
(Org used to be JuliaOpt, but jump stuff was domianting over other stuff so it wanted to get a house of its own)

text: Awesome! If you run into any problems with SDPAFamily, feel free to file an issue. I don’t think it has a ton of users so it might be possible to run into an edge case. Good luck with the talk!

text: <@UCZ7VBGUD>, if you find it interesting, I can PR an example to `SDPAFamily.jl`. I will post it in my soon-to-be blog, so you can have a look at it before. I will let you know here when it is ready.
